doc:
Martha Sleeper https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martha_Sleeper 0 Martha Sleeper (June 24, 1910 – March 25, 1983) was a film actress of the 1920s–1930s and, later, a Broadway stage actress. She studied dancing for five years with Russian ballet master, Louis H. Chalif, at his New York dancing studio. Her first public exhibitions were at Carnegie Hall at his class exhibitions. Martha_Sleeper ( June_24_,_1910 – March_25_,_1983 ) was a_film_actress of the_1920s – 1930s and , later , a_Broadway_stage_actress . She studied dancing for five_years with Russian_ballet_master , Louis_H._Chalif , at his_New_York_dancing_studio . Her_first_public_exhibitions were at Carnegie_Hall at his_class_exhibitions .
